ReportSection.name: Quiz
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 1
ReportSection.Static: Now that you’ve learned some of the diet and nutrition recommendations for older adults and thought about some foods you can eat and actions you can take to meet them, let's review and see how much you remember.

ReportSection.name: Answer1
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 1
ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item} The truth is, diet means all the foods you eat

When we speak about someone’s “diet,” what we really mean is the sum of food consumed by that person. It’s the foods that you typically eat. Changes to your diet can result in weight gain or weight loss, but healthy eating is about so much more than only focusing on weight-management.

ReportSection.name: Quiz2
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 2

ReportItem.options: a. 0.5g per kg of body weight|b. 100-120 mg|c. 1 to 1.5 g per kg of body weight|d. At least 50 mg

ReportSection.ReportItem:
What is the recommended daily intake of protein for older adults?

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Answer2
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 2

ReportItem.label: Answer 2
ReportItem.answer: c. 1 to 1.5 g per kg of body weight

ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item}

Unlike calcium or vitamin D, there is no blanket recommendation on the amount of protein all older adults should eat each day. Instead, it should be individualized based on your body weight. For every kg of body weight, aim to include 1-1.5 g of protein in your diet through foods such as chicken, eggs, nuts, legumes, or dairy products.

Check out the resource bank for ideas on how to include more protein in your diet.

ReportSection.name: Quiz3
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 3
ReportSection.ReportItem:
If you’re a vegetarian, it’s impossible to get enough protein in your diet.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Answer3
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 3
ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item} The truth is, it might be harder, but it can be done.

If you’re a vegetarian, legumes, spinach, and nuts are good protein options. However, it can be more challenging to get the protein you need from these sources. Make sure to speak with a healthcare provider to create a plan to achieve this with your diet. You can also supplement your diet with high protein drinks, pudding, and shakes.

ReportSection.name: Quiz4
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 4

ReportItem.options: a. Maintaining a balanced diet can help you avoid tooth decay|b. Healthy teeth allow you to comfortably and safely eat the food you want|c. Good oral hygiene can help you avoid malnourishment|d. All of the above

ReportSection.ReportItem:
If you’re a vegetarian, it’s impossible to get enough protein in your diet.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Answer4
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 4
ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item}

Good oral hygiene and a healthy diet support each other. It’s important for diet and nutrition so you can keep your mouth healthy and keep eating the foods you like. Proper oral care includes brushing and flossing twice a day, regular visits to your dentist, and making healthy diet choices.
